oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The route of administration of xylazine impacts the prolongation of local anesthesia in cattle
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Varner, K.M.
Keefer, Maya
Foster, Derek
Klein, Sarah
Dodam, JR
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Xylazine prolongs the duration of lidocaine when administered as a distal paravertebral block in cattle. This study investigates if the observed effect is due to the perineural administration of xylazine with lidocaine or if it could be achieved by systemic administration of xylazine and perineural lidocaine.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; Vol. 58 No. 58 (2024): 2024 AABP Annual Conference Proceedings; 210
